content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

In Julia, you can define a function `clean_column` to clean column names as follows:

```julia
function clean_column(col::AbstractString)
    # Lowercase the string
    str = lowercase(col)
    
    # Strip leading and trailing whitespaces
    str = strip(str)
    
    # Replace spaces and hyphens with underscores
    str = replace(str, r"\s|-" => "_")
    
    return str
end
```

This function takes a string `col` as input and returns the cleaned version of the column name. It first lowercases the string, then strips any leading or trailing whitespaces, and finally replaces spaces and hyphens with underscores.

You can use this function like so:

```julia
julia> clean_column("My Column")
"my_column"

julia> clean_column("my column")
"my_column"

julia> clean_column("my-column")
"my_column"
```

This function is generic and can be used to clean any string, not just column names.
